body_html:
This is almost assuredly something you do not want to do for performance reasons. You should be trying to write operations that do a lot of work per statement (i.e. in a batch-centric or simd fashion). If you are doing this for diagnostic purposes that is one thing, but model building, training and inference should not use anything like this.

If you really must do this you can use eval() or run() on a tensorflow tensor to get a numpy array back which supports individual index querying.

For futher guidance on using TensorFlow write StackOverflow questions. This forum is for bugs and feature requests. Thank you!

body:
This is almost assuredly something you do not want to do for performance reasons. You should be trying to write operations that do a lot of work per statement (i.e. in a batch-centric or simd fashion). If you are doing this for diagnostic purposes that is one thing, but model building, training and inference should not use anything like this.

If you really must do this you can use eval() or run() on a tensorflow tensor to get a numpy array back which supports individual index querying. 

For futher guidance on using TensorFlow write StackOverflow questions. This forum is for bugs and feature requests. Thank you!
